Articles.Content: Can a Structural Fuselage occlude parts inside it from drag like cargo bays do?

Well, it's not the structural fuselage itself that is doing it. It's the clipping. If you use the "move" tool to clip a part so that it is behind another part, it will be partially blocked from the airstream. Only cargo bays and fairings offer 100% protection. But if you clip a wheel into a fuel tank and observe the drag using the aero GUI and context menus, it will be less. If you do the same thing with a structural fuselage, I'm sure the exact same thing happens.
